page.title: 05HARWOOD'S STABLES,PULBOROUGH
page.content: Acreage:620,160 acres rented for training,3 sawdust gallops,1 valley and 1 normal gallop.Park Farm, Codmore Hill Farm and Pythingdean are rented. Harwood's own Coombelands. Harwood Stables contain 5 blocks of 20 stables,3,five furlong gallops protected by lime trees.The racing colours are yellow and red with a black 'H'.Thoroughbreds,only,are bought from America,Ireland,France and Newmarket in the Autumn.They are fed on Finnish oats,American hay and bran.Apprentice jockeys are under 7 stone,they are taken from 16 years. They begin work at 5am in the summer or 7am in winter.A full time vet, laboratory technician and secretaries are employed.Harwood's have 4 horse boxes.Their most successful win was the 1981 2000 guineas on To-Agori-Mou.
